00005 #ifndef EXAMPLES_PI_GENERATOR_SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
00006 #define EXAMPLES_PI_GENERATOR_SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
00007 
00008 #include <map>
00009 
00010 #if defined(__native_client__)
00011 #include <nacl/nacl_npapi.h>
00012 #else
00013 // Building a trusted plugin for debugging.
00014 #include "third_party/npapi/bindings/npapi.h"
00015 #include "third_party/npapi/bindings/nphostapi.h"
00016 #endif
00017 
00018 
00019 namespace pi_generator {
00020   // This class represents the Pepper3D object that gets exposed to the browser
00021   // code.
00022 
00023   class ScriptingBridge : public NPObject {
00024    public:
00025     typedef bool (ScriptingBridge::*Method)(const NPVariant* args,
00026                                             uint32_t arg_count,
00027                                             NPVariant* result);
00028     typedef bool (ScriptingBridge::*Property)(NPVariant* result);
00029 
00030     explicit ScriptingBridge(NPP npp) : npp_(npp) {}
00031     virtual ~ScriptingBridge();
00032 
00033     // These methods represent the NPObject implementation.  The browser calls
00034     // these methods by calling functions in the |np_class| struct.
00035     virtual void Invalidate();
00036     virtual bool HasMethod(NPIdentifier name);
00037     virtual bool Invoke(NPIdentifier name,
00038                         const NPVariant* args,
00039                         uint32_t arg_count,
00040                         NPVariant* result);
00041     virtual bool InvokeDefault(const NPVariant* args,
00042                                uint32_t arg_count,
00043                                NPVariant* result);
00044     virtual bool HasProperty(NPIdentifier name);
00045     virtual bool GetProperty(NPIdentifier name, NPVariant* result);
00046     virtual bool SetProperty(NPIdentifier name, const NPVariant* value);
00047     virtual bool RemoveProperty(NPIdentifier name);
00048 
00049     static bool InitializeIdentifiers();
00050 
00051     static NPClass np_class;
00052 
00053     // These methods are exposed via the scripting bridge to the browser.
00054     // Each one is mapped to a string id, which is the name of the method that
00055     // the broswer sees.  For example, Paint() has id 'paint', so in the browser
00056     // JavaScript, you would write tumbler.paint() to invoke the Paint() method
00057     // in this object.
00058     //
00059     // Each of these methods wraps a method in the associated Pepper3D object,
00060     // which is where the actual implementation lies.
00061 
00062     // Draws the quarter-circle image representing the stochasitc PI generator.
00063     bool Paint(const NPVariant* args, uint32_t arg_count, NPVariant* result);
00064 
00065    private:
00066     NPP npp_;
00067     NPObject* window_object_;
00068 
00069     static NPIdentifier id_paint;
00070 
00071     static std::map<NPIdentifier, Method>* method_table;
00072     static std::map<NPIdentifier, Property>* property_table;
00073   };
00074 
00075 }  // namespace pi_generator
00076 
00077 #endif  // EXAMPLES_PI_GENERATOR_SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
